1.text: Draw a circle and an oblong below that overlaps the circle.

2.text: Add a small circle on the left side of the drawing for the head and sketch the neck using curved lines that connect to the body.

3.text: Draw the turtle’s feet using rectangular shapes.

4.text: Draw the eyes using a small circle and curved lines for the eyebrows.

5.text: Draw the turtle’s shell from the circle you have drawn earlier.

6.text: Sketch out the body and the legs from the outline.

7.text: Draw a pattern for the turtle’s shell using squares and curves.

10.text: Draw an oblong for the body.

11.text: Draw the legs using a curved rectangle-like shape.

12.text: Draw the turtle’s shell from the outline.

13.text: Draw a series of hexagon shapes as part of the shell’s pattern.

14.text: Finish the pattern of the shell by adding a series of lines.

15.text: Draw the head and the eyes.

16.text: Sketch out the legs from the pattern you made earlier.

17.text: Sketch out small square patterns on the turtle’s body.

20.text: Draw an oval with a sharp edge on the left for the head.

21.text: Draw a big oval for the body and shell.

22.text: Draw a curve inside the big oval.

23.text: Draw three oblongs attached to the body for the feet.

24.text: Based on the outline, darken the necessary lines and add the eyes and mouth of the turtle.

25.text: Add details to your turtle such as stripes and shell pattern.

26.text: Erase all the unwanted unnecessary outlines.

28.text: Draw a big oval for the shell and body of the turtle.

29.text: Draw a semi-trapezoid shape beside the big oval for the head.

30.text: Draw three rectangles below the shell.

31.text: Draw a  big interconnected curve  for the tail.

32.text: Most snapping turtles have spiked shells; draw three series of spikes on the shell.

33.text: Based on the outline, draw the whole body of the turtle.

34.text: Add details such as the shell pattern and skin texture.
